messages.subject: Re: Blog Carnival for unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... When is Learn Nothing Day?  It s funny that this came up because I just wrote a blog post about learning nothing.
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> The coming collection will be about Learn Nothing Day!
>

When is Learn Nothing Day? It's funny that this came up because I just wrote a blog post about learning nothing. http://peaceondarknights.blogspot.com/2009/06/dont-learn-anything-today.html

I'm looking forward to reading all those blog posts tomorrow.

Emily

messages.subject: Blog Carnival for unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: The coming collection will be about Learn Nothing Day! Meredith is creating and organizing these.  The current batch (collected in June) contains:
messages.messageBody:
The coming collection will be about Learn Nothing Day!

Meredith is creating and organizing these. The current batch
(collected in June) contains:
==================

Travels and Journeys of the mind

Gillian leads us off with a whole blogful of travels:
http://www.intenselives.blogspot.com/

Ren takes us to visit her grandparents farm and a journey into her past:
http://radicalunschooling.blogspot.com/2009/06/trip-to-nw-farm.html

Amy Dingmann relates her 550 mile motorcycle trip to her unschooling
life:
http://tinyurl.com/nf23zy

Elizabeth Berning talks about her travel dreams and real life travels:
http://bffla.blogspot.com/2009/05/my-travel-dreams.html

And I muse about travels of the mind alongside a local swimming hole:

http://the-dismal-life.blogspot.com/2009/07/waterways.html


If you haven't had enough, here's a page that lists some other
unschoolers' blogs you can peruse:

http://organiclearning.org/resources.html

=======================
(end of the quote, back to this post)

=======================
I'm listing them here because there are a couple of formatting
glitches on the site itself, but the collection is cool.

These blog carnivals are a good way to get a cross-section of some
different blogs and writings that you might have missed. I enjoy them
because they're a mix of people I know and people I don't, but writing
about similar topics.

The real site for it is here, and it doesn't require special writing
but can be a post you've already written.
http://familyrun.ning.com/forum/topics/here-we-go-julys-blog-carnival

I will probably be too busy to think about it later in the month, so
if some of you here could remind people around Learn Nothing Day to
consider sending links to applicable posts there, I'd appreciate it.

Sandra
